data.title: East Ohio Conference of The United Methodist Church
data.text:
OBITUARIES

To submit the obituary of an EOC clergy, a clergy spouse, a child of a clergy person, or a surviving spouse, family should contact Melissa McGee, executive secretary to the Bishop, by phone at (330) 499-3972 ext. 112 or via e-mail.

July 2024

Charles D. Beatty, retired Local Pastor, died July 22. A viewing will be held July 26 from 12:00-2:00 p.m. at New Rumley Global Methodist Church (41395 Scio-New Rumley Rd., New Rumley, OH 43988). Funeral services will be held immediately following the viewing.

Pastor Beatty is survived by wife Klara; children Brigette (Keith) Rose, Daniel (Amanda Reed) Beatty, and Chrissie Gerber; and five grandchildren.

Pastor Beatty served Buena Vista, Cadiz Asbury Chapel, Branch, and Mingo Junction First United Methodist churches. He retired in 2012.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.kochfuneral.com.

Dorothy Walther, surviving spouse of the Rev. Roy A. Walther, died July 1. A viewing will be held July 12 at 10:00 a.m. at Damascus Methodist Church (300 Valley Rd., Damascus, OH) with a service to follow at 11:00 a.m.

Mrs. Walther is survived by sons Roy Jr. (Laura) and James (Lori), and four grandchildren.

Rev. Roy A. Walther served the following churches in Ohio: Antioch, Hannibal, Sugar Grove, Lansing, Caldwell, Wellsville First, Trinity, North Liberty, Butler Trinity, and Perrysville. He retired in 1997 and died in 2020.

Memorial contributions may be made to Damascus Methodist Church Missions Fund or Copeland Oaks Retirement Community Lifecare Fund.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.starkmemorial.com.

June 2024

David Bloor, retired Elder, died June 10. A memorial service was held June 27 at 11:00 a.m. at East Sparta Community Church (2041 Pine St. SE, East Sparta, OH 44626).

Rev. Bloor is survived by two sons and their families.

Rev. Bloor served the following Ohio churches: East Sparta, Waynesburg, Massillon: First, Alliance: Bolton, Lexington, Uhrichsville: First, Salem, and Avon. He retired in 1999.

Memorial contributions may be made to East Sparta Community Church.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.grfuneralhome.com.

May 2024

Terry E. Litton, retired Elder, died May 25. Calling hours were held June 1 from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. at Auble Funeral Home (512 E. Oak St., Orrville, Ohio 44667).

Rev. Dr. Litton is survived by his wife Marilee; children Michelle (Charles) Betts, Beth (Brian) Canfield, Amy (Steve) Burd, and Jessica (Daniel) Nicewarner; seven grandchildren and one great-grandson.

Rev. Dr. Litton served the following Ohio churches: McZena/Hope, Chippewa: Church at the Lake, Ashland: Emmanuel, Orrville: Trinity, and Cambridge First. He retired in 2007.

Memorial contributions may be made to Cambridge First UMC (PO Box 1166, Cambridge, Ohio 43725).

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.aublefuneralhome.com.

Melvin W. Lindberg, retired Elder, died May 23. Calling hours were held May 29 from 6:00-8:00 p.m. at Reed Funeral Home-North Canton Chapel (801 Pittsburg Ave. NW, North Canton, Ohio 44720). Funeral services were held May 30 at 11:00 a.m. at Zion Lutheran Church (349 Lindy Lane Ave. NW, North Canton, Ohio 44720).

Rev. Dr. Lindberg is survived by his wife Louise; sons Philip (Lisa), Andrew, and Thomas (Sharen); and seven grandchildren.

Rev. Dr. Lindberg served the following Ohio churches: Youngstown: Grace, Loy’s Corners, Alliance: Salem, Smith Corners, Wellsville: First, Bellaire: South, Tiltonsville, North Lawrence: Chapel of the Cross, Hathaway, Massillon Wesley, and Justus. He retired in 1998.

Memorial contributions may be made to Camp Wanake in care of the East Ohio Conference of The United Methodist Church.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.reedfuneralhome.com.

April 2024

Aletta R. Burkholder, retired Local Pastor, died April 20. A funeral service was held April 28.

Pastor Burkholder is survived by husband Ron; children Alan (Amanda), Rick (Sarah), Christi (Andy) Milliken, and Dan (Angela); 17 grandchildren; and seven great-grandchildren.

Pastor Burkholder served Bulah Calvary, Kelloggsville, and Madison Park United Methodist churches. She retired in 2011.

Memorial contributions may be made to Perry UMC (3875 Main St., Perry, OH 44081) or Hospice of the Western Reserve (PO Box 72101, Cleveland, OH 44192).

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.behmfuneral.com.

March 2024

Forrest Waller, retired Elder, died March 31. A celebration of life service was held April 4 at 11:00 a.m. at Cuyahoga Falls First UMC (245 Portage Trl., Cuyahoga Falls, OH 44221) with visitation one hour prior.

Rev. Waller is survived by children Jackie (Mark) and Paul (Jenny), and five grandchildren.

Rev. Waller served the following Ohio churches: Brookfield, Oberlin: First, Coshocton: Grace, and Cuyahoga Falls: First. He retired in 2001.

Memorial contributions may be made to Cuyahoga Falls First UMC Music and Worship Endowment.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.cliffordshoemaker.com.

Lorraine S. Thompson, surviving spouse of the Rev. Ernest Thompson, died March 7. A memorial service will be announced at a later date when family can gather.

Mrs. Thompson is survived by children, Joy (Bill) Watts, David (Kathy) Thompson, and Jon (Brenda) Thompson; son-in-law Bernie Sauer; eight grandchildren; and 12 great-grandchildren.

Rev. Ernest Thompson served the following churches in Ohio: Collins, Henrietta/Birmingham, Columbia Station, Congress Federated, and Congress. He retired in 1980 and died in 2002.

Memorial contributions may be made to Habitat for Humanity, The Wayne County Humane Society, or Salvation Army.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.mcintirebradhamsleek.com.

February 2024

Wynn A. Lembright, retired Elder, died February 17. A memorial service will be held June 5 at 11:00 a.m. at New Hope Academy (1820 Downs Blvd., Franklin, TN 37064).

Rev. Lembright is survived by wife Bonnie, children Holly (Corey) Martin and Jonathan (Jennifer) Lembright, and seven grandchildren.

Rev. Lembright served in extension ministry as chaplain, area representative and regional director for Fellowship of Christian Athletes of the Greater Philadelphia Area and as dean of admissions for Taylor University. He retired in 2008.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.smithfuneral.com.

Jane E. Wilds, surviving spouse of the Rev. Neal Wilds, died February 19. Arrangements are in process for a possible memorial in Columbus, OH.

Mrs. Wilds is survived by children Rebecca and Chris, a son-in-law, and two grandchildren.

Rev. Neal Wilds served Brooklyn Memorial and Cleveland: Faith United Methodist churches. He retired in 2004 and died in 2019.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.cookandsonpallay.com.

Jack O. Schierloh, retired Elder, died February 18. A remembrance service for family and friends will be held soon to celebrate the lives of both Rev. Schierloh and his wife, Jane, who preceded him in death.

Rev. Schierloh is survived by children Jay (Stacey), Jackie, and Tim (Teri); 10 grandchildren; and 15 great-grandchildren.

Rev. Schierloh served the following churches in Ohio: Aurora, Cuyahoga Falls: Trinity, Cleveland: Simpson, Lakewood: Inner City Worker-West Side Methodist Parish, Cleveland: Peoples, Mentor Plains, and Middlefield. He retired in 1998.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.mcvfuneralhomes.com. Â

Elizabeth Parks, surviving spouse of the Rev. Richard Parks, died February 13.

Rev. Richard Parks served Paradise Hill, Lisbon, Ontario, and Lakewood United Methodist churches and served as Steubenville District Superintendent. He retired in 2007 and died in 2018.

David N. J. Smith, clergy spouse, died February 15. A memorial service was held at 1:00 p.m. March 9 at Mentor UMC (8600 Mentor Ave., Mentor, OH 44060). The service will be livestreamed at mentorumc.org.

Mr. Smith is survived by his wife the Rev. Dr. Ivy Smith, four adult children, and one minor child.

Rev. Dr. Ivy Jo Smith is currently appointed to Mentor UMC. She also served Pearl Road, Canton: Crossroads, Simpson, James S. Thomas, and Canfield UMCs.

Memorial contributions may be made to Mentor UMC.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.davisbabcock.com.

Thomas S. Taylor, retired Elder, died February 22. Services were held February 24 at 1:00 p.m. in Cascade Hall at Wesleyan Village (807 West Ave., Elyria, OH 44035).

Rev. Taylor is survived by wife Nell and children Deborah, Dean, Wesley, and Kathryn.

Rev. Taylor served Plymouth/Shiloh, Lakeside, Delaware: Asbury, Euclid: East Shore, and Brecksville UMCs and as a Cleveland District Superintendent. He retired in 1996.

Miriam Moore, surviving spouse of the Rev. Homer H. Moore, died January 30. A small memorial service will be held later this spring.

Mrs. Moore is survived by children Terry (Carol) Moore, Tanya (Steve) Whitaker, Melody Lee, Mark (Linda) Moore; six grandchildren; and five great-grandchildren.

Rev. Homer H. Moore served Galena, Collins West Hartland, Rocky River, Chesterland Trinity, and South Arlington United Methodist Churches. He retired in 1990 and died in 1996.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.swigarteasterlingfuneralhome.com.

January 2024

Richard Ferrell, retired Elder, died January 17. Calling hours were held January 22 at 10:00 a.m. at Schneeberger Funeral Home (2222 Fulton Rd. NW, Canton, OH 44709) with a funeral service following.

Rev. Ferrell is survived by his grandchildren and great-grandchildren.

Rev. Ferrell served Bergholz, Dillonvale/Rayland, McDonald, Steubenville: LaBelle View, Youngstown: Mahoning, Canton: Dueber, New Franklin, and Canton: Trinity UMCs. He retired in 1990.

Memorial contributions may be made to World Gospel Mission.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.schneebergerfuneral.com.

December 2023

Evelyn Ferrell, clergy spouse, died December 5. Calling hours were held December 12 at 11:00 a.m. at Schneeberger Funeral Home (2222 Fulton Rd. NW, Canton, OH 44709).

Mrs. Ferrell is survived by her husband Rev. Richard H. Ferrell and many grandchildren and great-grandchildren.

Rev. Richard H. Ferrell served Bergholz, Dillonvale/Rayland, McDonald, Steubenville: LaBelle View, Youngstown: Mahoning, Canton: Dueber, New Franklin, and Canton: Trinity United Methodist churches. He retired in 1990.

Memorial contributions may be made to World Gospel Mission.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.schneebergerfuneral.com.

Thomas McFarren, retired Elder, died December 1. Friends were received December 6 from 5:00 to 7:00 p.m. at Reed Funeral Home North Canton Chapel (801 Pittsburg Ave. NW, North Canton, OH 44720) and December 7 from 10:00 to 11:00 a.m. at Grace UMC (1720 Schneider St. NW, North Canton, OH 44720). The funeral service followed at 11:00 a.m. at Grace UMC.

Rev. McFarren is survived by children Elizabeth (Mark) Clemons, Kathleen (Michael) Minor, and Kenneth (Kyle) McFarren; six grandchildren; and three great-grandchildren.

Rev. McFarren served Canton: St. Paul’s, Beach City, North Canton: Grace, Ashland: Christ, Howland, and North Royalton UMCs. He retired in 2005.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.reedfuneralhome.com.

Sturman Moore, retired Local Pastor, died December 3. Visitation was held at Bundy-Law Funeral Home (120 N 11th St., Cambridge, OH 43725) December 6 from 4:00 to 7:00 p.m. with funeral services held December 7 at 11:00 a.m.

Pastor Moore is survived by his wife Shirley; children Joseph (Mandy) Moore, Jennifer (Jerry) Blattner, and Benjamin Moore; six grandchildren; and four great-grandchildren.

Pastor Moore served Kennonsburg, Duncan Falls, and Cambridge: Christ UMCs. He retired in 2018.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.bundy-lawfuneralhome.com.

November 2023

Kathryn Buchanan, clergy spouse, died November 21. Services were held January 6, 2024, at 2:00 p.m. at Ohio Living Breckenridge Village Lyons Chapel (36851 Ridge Rd., Willoughby, OH 44094).

Mrs. Buchanan is survived by her husband the Rev. John Buchanan; children Brad (Margaret) and Mary Lynne (James); and five grandchildren.

Rev. John Buchanan served Warren: First, Twinsburg, Church Hill, Mt. Vernon Gay Street, and Boardman First UMCs. He also served as Conference Program Council Associate Director, Youngstown District Superintendent, and Conference Council on Ministries Director before retiring in 1997.

Memorial contributions may be made to Chorus For A Cause (2624 19th St. NW, Canton, OH 44708).

James Edward Cake, retired Elder, died November 24. A funeral service was held December 2 at 1:00 p.m. at Westlake UMC (27650 Center Ridge Rd., Westlake, OH 44145). Friends will be received at the church beginning at 12:30 p.m.

Rev. Cake is survived by children Kimberlee (Brian) Tackett, Bradford (Emily) Cake, and Tammy Nelson; and eight grandchildren.

Rev. Cake served Belden UMC. He retired in 2008.

Memorial contributions may be made to St. Jude’s Children’s Hospital or the Dementia Society of America.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.misencikfuneralhome.com.

Joyce V. McCleery, clergy spouse, died November 18. A memorial service was held at LaPorte UMC (2071 Grafton Road, Elyria, OH 44035) November 25 at 4:00 p.m.

Mrs. McCleery is survived by her husband, the Rev. Jonathan McCleery; children Robert Davis, Zachary (Carolyn) Davis, and Julia (Bart) Dekker; stepchildren Greg (Ashley) McCleery and Rachel (Otis) McCleery; and eight grandchildren.

Rev. Jonathan McCleery served Mount Carmel/Pleasant Ridge, Mansfield: Trinity, Coshocton: Park, New Philadelphia: Broadway, LaPorte, and Bay UMCs. He retired in 2022.

Memorial contributions may be made to St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.laubenthalmercado.com.

October 2023

John P. Reiter, clergy spouse, died October 30. A funeral service was held November 3 at 1:00 p.m. at Snyder Funeral Homes Lexington Avenue Chapel (2553 Lexington Avenue, Mansfield, OH 44904).

Mr. Reiter is survived by his wife Rev. Patricia Reiter; children Cathy (John) Hopkins, John (Karen) and Steven (Sue); six grandchildren; and four great-grandchildren.

Rev. Patricia Reiter served Zion Chapel, Williamsport, Byesville: Main, and Loudonville United Methodist Churches. She retired in 2006.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.snyderfuneralhomes.com.

September 2023

James Stafford, retired Local Pastor, died September 20. A celebration of life service was held October 10 at 11:00 a.m. at Easton Chapel (3906 Easton St. NE, Canton, OH 44721).

Pastor Stafford is survived by wife Ann, children Robin (Steve) Smithberger and Christopher (Deana) Stafford, six grandchildren, and two great-grandchildren.

Pastor Stafford served East Springfield Christ, North Canton Werner, and Easton Chapel UMCs. He retired in 2010.

Memorial contributions may be made to the church.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.reedfuneralhome.com.

Charles S. Fast, clergy spouse, died September 23. A funeral service was held September 30 at Redeemer North Hill UMC.

Mr. Fast is survived by his wife Rev. Joyce Fast; children Charles (Susan), Lisa (Chris) Owens, John (Leslie), and Carrie (Tim) Morrison; and nine grandchildren.

Rev. Joyce Fast served Church of the Master, Palmyra, and Redeemer North Hill UMCs. She retired in 2008.

Memorial contributions may be made to Redeemer North Hill UMC.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.eckardbaldwin.com.

August 2023

William Maynard French, retired Elder, died August 31. A memorial service was held September 6 at 11:00 a.m. at Westbrook Park UMC (2521 12th St. NW, Canton, OH 44708).

Rev. Dr. French is survived by children Deborah French, Mark French, and Jon French; step-children Deni Lowery, Marcia Ogilvie, Mark Hyde, and Annie Arvidson; and multiple grandchildren and great-grandchildren.

Rev. Dr. French served Chatham/Lafayette, Macedonia, and Ashtabula: First UMCs and as Canton District Superintendent and Associate Director of Conference Council on Ministries. He retired in 1997.

Memorial contributions may be made to Westbrook Park UMC.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.arnoldfuneralhome.com.

Calvin R. Myers, Sr., retired Elder, died August 29. A funeral service was held September 2 at Heart of Steamboat UMC in Colorado. A second service will be held in Ohio November 18 at 11:00 a.m. at Berea UMC (170 Seminary St., Berea, OH 44017). Clergy are invited to robe and process.

Rev. Dr. Myers is survived by wife Marlyn, sons Calvin Jr. (Mary) and Michael, daughter Christa (Tim), and two grandsons.

Rev. Dr. Myers served New Philadelphia and Berea UMCs as well as on East Ohio Conference staff. He retired in 1993.

Memorial contributions may be made to Heart of Steamboat UMC.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.yampavalleyfh.com.

Rosa Clements-Milliner, retired Elder, died August 18. The funeral was held August 30 at 10:30 a.m. at Church of the Saviour UMC (2537 Lee Rd., Cleveland Heights, OH 44118) with visitation half an hour prior.

Rev. Clements-Milliner is survived by daughter Selena Wright-Johnson, son Joseph Clements III, three grandchildren, and 10 great-grandchildren.

Rev. Clements-Milliner served Elyria: Asbury, Lorain: Wesley, Aldersgate, Ashland: St. Paul, Orrville: St. Luke, Akron: North Hill, Werner, and Aurora UMCs. She retired in 2007.

Ruth Partridge, surviving spouse of the Rev. Stanley Partridge, died August 7. Visitation was held August 14 from 4:00-7:00 p.m. at Arnold Funeral Home (504 W. Maple St., Hartville, OH 44632). The funeral service was held August 15 at 10:30 a.m. at Werner UMC (5116 Werner Church Rd. NE, North Canton, OH 44721).

Mrs. Partridge is survived by sons Stephen (Susan), Mark (Donna), and John (Patti), and 10 grandchildren.

Rev. Stanley Partridge served Wildare, Akron: Grace, Akron: Faith, Stow, Millersburg, Akron: Park, Youngstown: Mahoning, and Werner UMCs. He died in 2014.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.arnoldfuneralhome.com.

July 2023

Alfred J. Hubler, retired Elder, died July 31. His body was donated to Case Western Reserve Medical School. A memorial service was held at Bay UMC 29931 Lake Rd., Bay Village, OH 44140 on September 6 at 11:00 a.m.

Rev. Hubler is survived by daughters Barbara Hubler and Sandy (Morrie) Scherrens, two grandchildren, and two great-grandchildren.

Before retiring in 1995, Rev. Hubler served at Bennetts Corners, Boardman, Solon, Bellevue, Poland, and Bay UMCs and as Superintendent of the Akron District.

Ezzie Milliner, clergy spouse, died July 4. A funeral service was held July 12 at 10:30 a.m. at Calhoun Funeral Home (23000 Rockside Rd., Beford Heights, OH 44146).

Mr. Milliner is survived by his wife Rev. Dr. Rosa Clements-Milliner, son Wilford (Lynn) Terion, stepson Joseph Clements III, stepdaughter Selena Johnson, three granddaughters, and two great-granddaughters.

Rev. Dr. Rosa Clements-Milliner served Elyria Asbury, Lorain Wesley, Aldersgate, Ashland St. Paul, Orrville St. Luke, Akron North Hill, Werner, and Aurora UMCs. She retired in 2007.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting calhounfuneral.com.

June 2023

Bige L. Combs, retired Associate Member, died June 25. A Celebration of Life service will be held at a later date.

Rev. Combs is survived by wife Jacquelyn; children Louise McCaul, James Combs, Lawrence Combs, Bige Combs, Jr., Roy (Sharon) Harris, and Richard (Sherri) Harris; 13 grandchildren and 12 great-grandchildren.

Rev. Combs served Melmore, Freeport, Smyrna, Westchester, Mt. Pleasant, and Maynard UMCs. He retired in 2001.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.bartleyfuneralhome.com.

Dorrine R. Burkhead, surviving spouse of the Rev. Merriel Burkhead, died June 12. A private family service was held.

Mrs. Burkhead is survived by daughter Gina Engleheart, two grandsons, and three great-grandchildren.

Rev. Merriel Burkhead served Shalersville, Cuyahoga Falls First, Dalton, Bellevue First, and Barberton United Methodist churches. He retired in 1988 and died in 2017.

Memorial contributions may be made to Alzheimer’s Association, 70 W. Streetsboro St., Suite 201, Hudson OH 44236.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.ctcfuneralandcremation.com.

May 2023

Carlton Young, retired Elder, died May 21.

Rev. Young is survived by wife Marjorie; children Robert Young, James Young, Carol Young Wilson, and Richard Young; and six grandchildren.

Rev. Young served as minister of music for Church of the Saviour UMC and Youngstown Trinity UMC. Afterward, he served on the editorial staff of Abingdon Press, as director of church music for the Board of Publications, as associate professor of Church Music for Perkins School of Theology, and as professor of Church Music for Scarritt College and then Candler School of Theology. He retired from the East Ohio Conference in 1991.

Virginia Schreckengost, surviving spouse of the Rev. George Schreckengost, died May 12. A funeral service was held May 20 at Sebring UMC.

Mrs. Schreckengost is survived by children Elaine Weaver, Ruth (Frank) Novak, Lois (Jim) Miller, John (John Kelly) Schreckengost, and Jim (Cathie) Schreckengost; and her grandchildren and great-grandchildren.

Rev. George Schreckengost served Youngstown Trinity, Oak Chapel, and Sebring UMCs in addition to being director of the North-East Ohio Regional Church Planning Office and associate director of Conference Council on Ministries. He retired in 2008 and died in 2020.

Memorial donations may be made to Sebring UMC or the Life Care Fund at Copeland Oaks.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.grfuneralhome.com.

Earl H. Bailey, Jr., retired Elder, died May 27. A celebration of life service was held at 2:00 p.m. on June 4 at Mt. Zion Community UMC (2637 Baum St. SE, Canton, OH 44707).

Rev. Bailey is survived by his wife Judy; sons Matthew (Stacey), Benjamin (Monique), and Christopher (Salley); and seven grandchildren.

Rev. Bailey served at Mt. Zion Community UMC and as conference evangelist. He retired in 2009.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.sandersfuneralhomes.com.

Mike Corwin, Local Pastor, died May 24. A funeral service was held June 3 at 1:00 p.m. at Bucyrus UMC (227 S. Walnut St., Bucyrus, OH 44820).

Pastor Corwin is survived by his wife Julie, children Stacy Ricker and Aaron (Jill) Corwin, five grandchildren, and two great-grandchildren.

Pastor Corwin served Leesville, Crestline First, Bucyrus Grace, Bucyrus Epworth, Bucyrus First, and Bucyrus UMCs.

Memorial contributions may be made to Bucyrus UMC.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.wisefuneral.com.

April 2023

James T. Henderson, retired Elder, died June 20, 2022. A memorial service was held June 28 in the Chapel of Central UMC in Monroe, NC.

Rev. Henderson is survived by wife Nancy, sons Timothy (Esmeralda) and Mark (Page); seven grandchildren; and five great-grandchildren.

Rev. Henderson served as a U.S. Air Force Chaplain and at churches in Ohio and New York. He retired from the East Ohio Conference in 1974.

Memorial contributions may be made to Disabled American Veterans, Food and Water Watch, or Southern Poverty Law Center.

Evelyn Fay Sutherland, surviving spouse of the Rev. Robert Sutherland, died February 2. A celebration of life service was held February 18 at Old Stone Evangelical Church in Amherst, OH.

Mrs. Sutherland is survived by children Kay (Chuck) Brod, Christine (Paul) Carmichael, Jan (Al) Starr, Robert J. Sutherland, and Barbara (Paul) Flores; 12 grandchildren; and 12 great-grandchildren.

Rev. Robert Sutherland served the Ohio Evangelical Conference, Ohio Sandusky Conference, and Ohio East Conference as well as Amherst Old Stone UMC in the East Ohio Conference. He retired in 1985.

James McConnell, retired Elder, died April 17. A graveside service was held April 21 at Westview Cemetery in Carrollton, OH.

Rev. McConnell is survived by his son Marvin (Linda) and two grandsons.

Rev. McConnell served Winterset, Lower Salem, Belmont, Conesville, New Washington, East Fairfield, Burbank Faith, Burbank Trinity, Adena Circuit, Malvern, Pleasant Grove, Canton Trinity, East Rochester, and Bayard UMCs. He retired in 1989.

Memorial contributions may be made to Canton Parks and Recreation, Attn: Amie Biltz, 1615 Stadium Park Dr. NW, Canton, OH 44718 (check memo: Shuffleboard Roof).

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.doddsfuneralhomes.com.

Jean Helen McFarren, clergy spouse, died April 9. A funeral service was held April 14 at Reed Funeral Home North Canton Chapel. Burial followed at North Lawn Cemetery.

Mrs. McFarren is survived by her husband, the Rev. Thomas McFarren; children Elizabeth (Mark), Kathleen (Michael), and Kenneth (Kyle); six grandchildren; and three great-grandchildren.

Rev. Thomas McFarren served Canton St. Paul’s, Beach City, North Canton Grace, Ashland Christ, Howland, and North Royalton UMCs. He retired in 2005.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.reedfuneralhome.com.

Janet M. Lynn, clergy spouse, died April 12. A memorial service was held April 22 at 11:00 a.m. at Berry-McGreevey Funeral Home (26691 Detroit Rd., Westlake, OH 44145).

Mrs. Lynn is survived by her husband, the Rev. David M. Lynn; children Beth (Len) Smith, Lisa (Bruce) Tully, Karen (Robert) Jorgensen, and Mark (Cathy) Lynn; and her grandchildren and great-grandchildren.

Rev. David Lynn served East Springfield, Warren First, and Rocky River UMCs. He retired in 1995.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.zmfh.com.

Phyllis Brown, surviving spouse of Rev. Craig Brown, died April 12. The funeral service was held at 11:00 a.m. on April 21 at Willis Funeral Home (12 Garfield Ave., Gallipolis, OH 45631). Burial and a graveside service were held at 2:30 p.m. in Glen Rest Memorial Estates (8029 East Main St., Reynoldsburg, OH 43068).

Mrs. Brown is survived by daughters Shelley Bartholow, Ellen James, and Aimee (Scott) Blevins, and five grandchildren.

Rev. Craig Brown served East Springfield Church of the Cross, North Mentor, and Melmore UMCs. He died in 2012.

Memorial contributions may be made to Ashland Theological Seminary.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.willisfuneralhome.com.

March 2023

Donald Booth, retired Elder, died December 15, 2022. A celebration of life service was held at 11:00 a.m. on April 29 at Calvary UMC (12062 South Ave., North Lima, OH 44452).

Rev. Booth is survived by his wife Martha, sons Joshua (Abigail) and Adam (Jessica), and eight grandchildren.

Rev. Booth served Lowellville/Marion Heights, Byesville: Main, Windham, North Lima, Bunker Hill, Akron: Faith/Redeemer, Deerfield, and Palmyra UMCs. He retired in 2015.

Memorial contributions may be made to Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson’s Research or to any of the churches Rev. Booth served.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.gilbert-fellers.com.

Maurine Moody Scott, widow of the late Rev. Jack Moody, died March 17. A memorial service was held at 2:00 p.m. April 22 at Gay Street UMC (18 North Gay St., Mt. Vernon, OH 43050).

Mrs. Scott is survived by her husband Jack Scott, daughters Martha Moody (Martin Jacobs) and Christine Moody Roudebush (Charlie Roudebush), five grandchildren, and two great-granddaughters.

Rev. Jack Moody served Magnolia, Akron First, Lakemore, Trinity, Toronto First, Canfield, Mt. Vernon Gay St., Mentor, Massillon Wesley, and Canton St. Pauls UMCs. He retired in 1982 and died in 1994.

Memorial contributions may be made to Gay Street UMC or the charity of your choice.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.snyderfuneralhomes.com.

Marilyn M. Waller, clergy spouse, died March 8. A celebration of life service was held March 24 at First UMC Cuyahoga Falls.

Mrs. Waller is survived by her husband the Rev. Forrest Waller; children Jackie (Mark) and Paul (Jenny); and five grandchildren.

Rev. Waller served Brookfield, Oberlin First, Coshocton Grace, and Cuyahoga Falls First UMCs. He retired in 2001.

Memorial contributions may be made to Cuyahoga Falls City Schools, Elementary School Reading Program.

Condolences may be sent to the family by visiting www.cliffordshoemaker.com.

Irwin E. Jennings, retired Elder, died March 22. A service was held June 11 at 2:00 p.m. in the open-air Jennings East Deck of the Lakeside Pavilion. Interment of ashes followed at 4:30 p.m. in the Lakeside Memorial Garden.

Rev. Jennings is survived by children Elizabeth (Kevin) Jennings Sibbring, Carrie (Charles Mahler) Jennings, and David (Linda Doepker) Jennings; and five grandchildren.

Rev. Jennings served East Liverpool Calvary, Elyria First, Barberton St. Paul’s, North Canton Faith, and Medina UMCs and as Wooster District Superintendent. He retired in 2001.

Memorial contributions may be made to Religious Life at Lakeside Chautauqua by visiting lakesideohio.com.

Richard A. Yaussy, retired Elder, died March 9. Services were held March 18 at 11:00 a.m. at Newton First Presbyterian Church in Newton, NC.
